Name: He's At Home
Ingredients: 60 ml Green Chartreuse (or alternative herbal liqueur)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Collins glass .
Prepare garnish of lime zest twist.
FINE STRAIN into chilled glass filled with crushed ice.
Express lime zest twist over the cocktail and use as garnish.
Review: LeNell's kind of drink and accompanying story. Other Chartreuse lover's should experiment.
History: This recipe is adapted from one by Del Pedro, Alexander's, New York City. It came to me (in 1997) courtesy of the infamous LeNell Smothers. To quote from Del, "I used to call this a 'Gatsby cooler' at one time, because there seems something kinda evilly 'Hampton-ish' about this drink, but I also called it 'He's At Home' which was the name given to porcelain dildos that Nantucket ship's captain's wives kept stashed in the flue of their fireplaces for the lonely winter nights when the old dog was chasing whales."
Nutrition: One serving of He's At Home contains 211 calories
